trans-unit.source: Change the StorSimple data encryption key
trans-unit.target: Change the StorSimple data encryption key

trans-unit.source: Describes how to authorize a StorSimple device so that it can change the data encryption key, and then explains the key change process.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to authorize a StorSimple device so that it can change the data encryption key, and then explains the key change process.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Authorize a device to change the service data encryption key in the Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Authorize a device to change the service data encryption key in the Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Typically, the device administrator will request that the service administrator authorize a device to change service data encryption keys.
trans-unit.target: Typically, the device administrator will request that the service administrator authorize a device to change service data encryption keys.

trans-unit.source: The service administrator will then authorize the device to change the key.
trans-unit.target: The service administrator will then authorize the device to change the key.

trans-unit.source: This step is performed in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: This step is performed in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: The service administrator can select a device from a displayed list of the devices that are eligible to be authorized.
trans-unit.target: The service administrator can select a device from a displayed list of the devices that are eligible to be authorized.

trans-unit.source: The device is then authorized to start the service data encryption key change process.
trans-unit.target: The device is then authorized to start the service data encryption key change process.

trans-unit.source: Which devices can be authorized to change service data encryption keys?
trans-unit.target: Which devices can be authorized to change service data encryption keys?

trans-unit.source: A device must meet the following criteria before it can be authorized to initiate service data encryption key changes:
trans-unit.target: A device must meet the following criteria before it can be authorized to initiate service data encryption key changes:

trans-unit.source: The device must be online to be eligible for service data encryption key change authorization.
trans-unit.target: The device must be online to be eligible for service data encryption key change authorization.

trans-unit.source: You can authorize the same device again after 30 minutes if the key change has not been initiated.
trans-unit.target: You can authorize the same device again after 30 minutes if the key change has not been initiated.

trans-unit.source: You can authorize a different device, provided that the key change has not been initiated by the previously authorized device.
trans-unit.target: You can authorize a different device, provided that the key change has not been initiated by the previously authorized device.

trans-unit.source: After the new device has been authorized, the old device cannot initiate the change.
trans-unit.target: After the new device has been authorized, the old device cannot initiate the change.

trans-unit.source: You cannot authorize a device while the rollover of the service data encryption key is in progress.
trans-unit.target: You cannot authorize a device while the rollover of the service data encryption key is in progress.

trans-unit.source: You can authorize a device when some of the devices registered with the service have rolled over the encryption while others have not.
trans-unit.target: You can authorize a device when some of the devices registered with the service have rolled over the encryption while others have not.

trans-unit.source: In such cases, the eligible devices are the ones that have completed the service data encryption key change.
trans-unit.target: In such cases, the eligible devices are the ones that have completed the service data encryption key change.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, StorSimple virtual devices are not shown in the list of devices that can be authorized to start the key change.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, StorSimple virtual devices are not shown in the list of devices that can be authorized to start the key change.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to select and authorize a device to initiate the service data encryption key change.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to select and authorize a device to initiate the service data encryption key change.

trans-unit.source: To authorize a device to change the key
trans-unit.target: To authorize a device to change the key

trans-unit.source: On the service dashboard page, click **Change service data encryption key**.
trans-unit.target: On the service dashboard page, click **Change service data encryption key**.

trans-unit.source: Change service encryption key
trans-unit.target: Change service encryption key

trans-unit.source: In the **Change service data encryption key** dialog box, select and authorize a device to initiate the service data encryption key change.
trans-unit.target: In the **Change service data encryption key** dialog box, select and authorize a device to initiate the service data encryption key change.

trans-unit.source: The drop-down list has all the eligible devices that can be authorized.
trans-unit.target: The drop-down list has all the eligible devices that can be authorized.

trans-unit.source: Click the check icon
trans-unit.target: Click the check icon

trans-unit.source: check icon
trans-unit.target: check icon

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to initiate the service data encryption key change
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to initiate the service data encryption key change

trans-unit.source: This step is performed in the Windows PowerShell for StorSimple interface on the authorized StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: This step is performed in the Windows PowerShell for StorSimple interface on the authorized StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] No operations can be performed in the Management Portal of your StorSimple Manager service until the key rollover is completed.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] No operations can be performed in the Management Portal of your StorSimple Manager service until the key rollover is completed.

trans-unit.source: If you are using the device serial console to connect to the Windows PowerShell interface, perform the following steps.
trans-unit.target: If you are using the device serial console to connect to the Windows PowerShell interface, perform the following steps.

trans-unit.source: To initiate the service data encryption key change
trans-unit.target: To initiate the service data encryption key change

trans-unit.source: Select option 1 to log on with full access.
trans-unit.target: Select option 1 to log on with full access.

trans-unit.source: At the command prompt, type:
trans-unit.target: At the command prompt, type:

trans-unit.source: After the cmdlet has successfully completed, you will get a new service data encryption key.
trans-unit.target: After the cmdlet has successfully completed, you will get a new service data encryption key.

trans-unit.source: Copy and save this key for use in step 3 of this process.
trans-unit.target: Copy and save this key for use in step 3 of this process.

trans-unit.source: This key will be used to update all the remaining devices registered with the StorSimple Manager service.
trans-unit.target: This key will be used to update all the remaining devices registered with the StorSimple Manager service.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This process must be initiated within four hours of authorizing a StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This process must be initiated within four hours of authorizing a StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: This new key is then sent to the service to be pushed to all the devices that are registered with the service.
trans-unit.target: This new key is then sent to the service to be pushed to all the devices that are registered with the service.

trans-unit.source: An alert will then appear on the service dashboard.
trans-unit.target: An alert will then appear on the service dashboard.

trans-unit.source: The service will disable all the operations on the registered devices, and the device administrator will then need to update the service data encryption key on the other devices.
trans-unit.target: The service will disable all the operations on the registered devices, and the device administrator will then need to update the service data encryption key on the other devices.

trans-unit.source: However, the I/Os (hosts sending data to the cloud) will not be disrupted.
trans-unit.target: However, the I/Os (hosts sending data to the cloud) will not be disrupted.

trans-unit.source: If you have a single device registered to your service, the rollover process is now complete and you can skip the next step.
trans-unit.target: If you have a single device registered to your service, the rollover process is now complete and you can skip the next step.

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple devices registered to your service, proceed to step 3.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple devices registered to your service, proceed to step 3.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Update the service data encryption key on other StorSimple devices
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Update the service data encryption key on other StorSimple devices

trans-unit.source: These steps must be performed in the Windows PowerShell interface of your StorSimple device if you have multiple devices registered to your StorSimple Manager service.
trans-unit.target: These steps must be performed in the Windows PowerShell interface of your StorSimple device if you have multiple devices registered to your StorSimple Manager service.

trans-unit.source: The key that you obtained in Step 2: Use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to initiate the service data encryption key change must be used to update all the remaining StorSimple device registered with the StorSimple Manager service.
trans-unit.target: The key that you obtained in Step 2: Use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to initiate the service data encryption key change must be used to update all the remaining StorSimple device registered with the StorSimple Manager service.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to update the service data encryption on your device.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to update the service data encryption on your device.

trans-unit.source: To update the service data encryption key
trans-unit.target: To update the service data encryption key

trans-unit.source: Use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to connect to the console.
trans-unit.target: Use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to connect to the console.

trans-unit.source: Select option 1 to log on with full access.
trans-unit.target: Select option 1 to log on with full access.

trans-unit.source: At the command prompt, type:
trans-unit.target: At the command prompt, type:

trans-unit.source: Provide the service data encryption key that you obtained in [Step 2: Use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to initiate the service data encryption key change](#to-initiate-the-service-data-encryption-key-change).
trans-unit.target: Provide the service data encryption key that you obtained in [Step 2: Use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to initiate the service data encryption key change](#to-initiate-the-service-data-encryption-key-change).
